entry.title: [ios] Remove WebStateActivatedAt() from FullscreenWebStateListObserver
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 82789440feaede7a752d2f0dd6c3602e15105fb4

with a fix.



The original CL was reverted because InactiveTabsTestCase tests failed.

There were 2 failing points:

1. MoveContentBelowHeader() in fullscreen_content_adjustment_util.mm

because inactive tabs are not the "realized" state yet and they

don't have the CRWWebViewProxy object when WebStates move from

an inactive browser to an active browser.

2. Call removeObserver: to a non-registered object in

fullscreen_web_view_resizer.mm.



The first issue was fixed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4737971 by

forcefully realizing the active WebState just after active_index_ is

updated.



This CL has a workaround for the second issue by adding

`_installedObserver` flag in FullscreenWebViewResizer.



Original change's description:

> [ios] Remove WebStateActivatedAt() from FullscreenWebStateListObserver

>

> This CL updates FullscreenWebStateListObserver to handle the activation of WebState in WebStateListDidChange().

>

> Bug: 1442546

> Change-Id: Idd70ccf6f4b40a22296ce0c4e918ca3b67a6c103

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705344

> Commit-Queue: Asami Doi

> Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177810}



Bug: 1442546

Change-Id: I4de7a7ebd0c4a7c4d70a8e5c0154f87bc103c880

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742381

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

Commit-Queue: Asami Doi

entry.title: [ios][RBS] Fix FollowTabHelper failing DCHECK
entry.content:
Content of IsWebChannelsEnabled() can change at runtime, this after

change https://crrev.com/c/4711116.

For this reason DCHECK(_followIPHPresenter) started failing and

previous fix was not enough (https://crrev.com/c/4732997).



In this CL FollowTabHelper is always initialised (see

tab_helper_util.mm). As a consequence, IsWebChannelsEnabled checks

were added inside follow_tab_helper.mm.



A similar solution was adopted for PriceNotificationsTabHelper,

see: https://crrev.com/c/4447579.



Bug: 1468339

Change-Id: I74e039f84c6100665d0b10c4121e95eee844f091

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4732832

entry.title: Fix a few more tests that fail with Rust JSON parser
entry.content:
AggregationServiceNetworkFetcherTest



This test makes requests the responses to which must be parsed. With

the new Rust JSON parser, that parsing occurs in a thread-pool, so

the test must run the loop until that parsing is complete.



SearchResultLoaderTest, SearchResponseParserTest,

TranslationResponseParserTest, TranslationResultLoaderTest



Handling JSON now requires a thread pool, when using the Rust

parser. The `SingleThreadTaskEnvironment` does not supply this,

but a full `TaskEnvironment` does.





DevicePolicyDecoderTest



The precise form of that error differs depending on which JSON

parser is in use. But this test is really only checking that the

JSON error is reported, so this CL modifies the assertion to match.



Bug: 1455145

Change-Id: Ie0890db7f985239fb4ce665795f6a280483a3e54

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Options controller persists pref and records metrics
entry.content:
This CL adds the model and the mediator for the autofill options

component. It initializes subcomponents after the fragment is created.



The model contains UI state and view callbacks.

The mediator persists the pref on change and records each unique change.

When the fragment is resumed, the mediator will update the model to

reflect the latest state of the pref.



The UI is unchanged and strings are far from being finalized.

entry.title: bindings: Use the exact type for sync iterator types
entry.content:
Synchronous iterator type for interface type X is actually implemented

as SyncIterator (a subclass of ScriptWrappable), but SyncIteratorType

(typedef to `object`) has been used to represent synchronous iterator

types as return type just because it works as a placeholder.



The trick was that the bindings generator uses `auto&&` for return type

and does not need to know the exact return type (unless there are overloads).

```

auto&& return_value = blink_receiver->foo(...);

bindings::V8SetReturnValue(info, return_value, ...);

```

However, when there are overloads (including optional arguments), the

bindings generator needs to know the exact return type.

```

ReturnType return_value; // Needs to declare `return_value` with the exact type.

do {

if (no args) {

return_value = blink_receiver->foo();

break;

}

if (arg[0] is type X) {

auto&& arg1_x = NativeValueTraits::ArgumentValue(...);

return_value = blink_receiver->foo(arg1_x);

break;

}

...

} while (false);

bindings::V8SetReturnValue(info, return_value, ...);

```



When we will implement Web IDL async iterable, which supports optional

arguments, the bindings generator needs to know the exact return type.

So, this patch makes the bindings generator use the exact type instead

of `SyncIteratorType` (just a placeholder).



Bug: 1087157

Change-Id: I2f6f68d0cd52d7c673395ed58f76fcd52e0467df

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4743319

Commit-Queue: Yuki Shiino

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Reviewed-by: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

entry.title: [Desktop][I18n] Remove address references from AddressComponentUi.
entry.content:
I18n requires supporting all ServerFieldType values. These field

values should be stored in a generic

mapping. However, this task can't be achieved directly cause Web

IDL doesn't support mappings. AutofillProfile fields will be passed

in the array [(ServerFieldType, string)] to the UI code.



This makes committing the value of 1 field O(# of fields) task.

Thus, we switch to committing changes only when user clicks the

"Save" editor button.



This CL is an intermediate step towards supporting all ServerFieldType

fields. It effectively makes address_edit_dialog write all changes to

a local map and commit them only upon user clicking the "Save" button.



Bug: 1441904

entry.title: [BRP] Add raw_ptr<T>::AsEphemeralRawAddr()
entry.content:
- Add `raw_ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr()` to provide *extremely*

short-lived `T**` or `T*&`.

- Users must NOT store `T**` or `T*&` anywhere, even as a local

variable.

- Users must NOT use `raw_ptr`, `T**` or `T*&` multiple times within

an expression.



```

void GetSomeClassPtr(SomeClass** out_arg) {

*out_arg = ...;

}

void FillPtr(SomeClass*& out_arg) {

out_arg = ...;

}

void Foo() {

raw_ptr ptr;

GetSomeClassPtr(&ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr());

FillPtr(ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr()); // Implicitly converted into |SomeClass*&|.

}

```



See `//base/memory/raw_ptr.md` for more details.



Bug: 1469511

Change-Id: Ief2648b1e2193a73ece16de70171a5643b4811bf

entry.title: Revert "Explicitly check when local time conversion fails."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7e52434b1df6f7d13e20cdb7a0106aa72239f08a.



Reason for revert: the new test is failing, and is likely causing other tests to fail as well.



See:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37593/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Sample failure:



[ RUN ] TimeOfDayTest.ReturnsNullTimeWhenLocalTimeFails

==324697==WARNING: MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value

#0 0x5632f6dd4ee3 in base::Time::Exploded::HasValidValues() const ./../../base/time/time.cc:302:23

#1 0x5632f61d489d in ash::TimeOfDay::ToTimeToday() const ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day.cc:54:12

#2 0x5632ea366c82 in ash::(anonymous namespace)::TimeOfDayTest_ReturnsNullTimeWhenLocalTimeFails_Test::TestBody() ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day_unittest.cc:98:3

#3 0x5632f496278c in HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest-internal-inl.h:0:10

#4 0x5632f496278c in testing::Test::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:2670:5

#5 0x5632f49650b3 in testing::TestInfo::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:2849:11

#6 0x5632f4967144 in testing::TestSuite::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:3008:30

#7 0x5632f4994c10 in testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:5866:44

#8 0x5632f4993ce2 in HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest-internal-inl.h:0:10

#9 0x5632f4993ce2 in testing::UnitTest::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:5440:10

#10 0x5632f6f60f30 in RUN_ALL_TESTS ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/include/gtest/gtest.h:2284:73

#11 0x5632f6f60f30 in base::TestSuite::Run() ./../../base/test/test_suite.cc:461:16

#12 0x5632f6f6c137 in Run ./../../base/functional/callback.h:152:12

#13 0x5632f6f6c137 in RunTestSuite ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:179:38

#14 0x5632f6f6c137 in base::(anonymous namespace)::LaunchUnitTestsInternal(base::OnceCallback, unsigned long, int, unsigned long, bool, base::RepeatingCallback, base::OnceCallback) ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:240:10

#15 0x5632f6f6b824 in base::LaunchUnitTests(int, char**, base::OnceCallback, unsigned long) ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:288:10

#16 0x5632f68395ae in main ./../../ash/test/ash_unittests.cc:29:10

#17 0x7f1f985cd082 in __libc_start_main ??:0:0

#18 0x5632e637b029 in _start ??:0:0



Uninitialized value was created by an allocation of 'now' in the stack frame

#0 0x5632f61d4706 in ash::TimeOfDay::ToTimeToday() const ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day.cc:48:3





Other tests seem to be failing for the same reasons, e.g.

ScheduledFeatureTest.HandlesLocalTimeFailuresSunsetToSunrise



Original change's description:

> Explicitly check when local time conversion fails.

>

> base::Time::LocalExplode() can fail. The API says to check

> base::Time::Exploded::HasValidValues() to detect this.

>

> This functionally is probably the same as before because we

> were passing the exploded output to base::Time::FromLocalExploded()

> immediately after, and presumably, that would fail if the exploded

> input had invalid values. But it's clearer to the reader if this

> is explicitly checked first.

>

> A unit test has also been added to TimeOfDay.

>

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Report high confidence on re-visit after expiration
entry.content:
The first time the user visits a page, after a previously applied

3PC exception has expired, a high confidence signal is reported so

that the entry point may be animated.



This only occurs once, and visits timestamps are only recorded while

an active exception exists, and are cleared otherwise.



Bug: 1446230

Change-Id: Ia764698e46287440485df737373e7d8fd71bd9dc

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179486}

entry.title: [iOS] Reliably clear kSelectedTypesPerAccount pref of removed accounts
entry.content:
When an account is removed from the device (not just signed out from

Chrome!), corresponding per-account settings should get cleared.



This is a follow-up to crrev.com/c/4720751, which implemented the main

part of this, but missed one edge case: An account first being signed

out from Chrome, then separately removed from the device.



This CL fixes that edge case by moving the

ClearAccountSettingsPrefsOfRemovedAccounts() calls to more-reliable

places: It now gets called whenever the list of accounts on the

device changes (whatever the state of Chrome sign-in may be at that

point), plus once on browser startup.



Bug: 1447015

Change-Id: I3901d48f6476755a5b50daec02edc93dc980ed52

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4747642

Reviewed-by: Jérôme Lebel

Commit-Queue: Marc Treib

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179485}

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate remaining signin WebUIs tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest.
entry.content:
As part of the migration, the tests can now directly refer to

SyncConfirmationStyle and signin_metrics::ReauthAccessPoint C++ enums,

which was previously not possible.



WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.



Bug: 1457360

Change-Id: I5fd147691f2e6ed42aa0acbff617a1eb58f0508a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739421

Auto-Submit: Demetrios Papadopoulos

Commit-Queue: Demetrios Papadopoulos

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: David Roger

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179484}

entry.title: Revert "Recognize Clipboard Search suggestions as Search types."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2bb09e52d1747c1efae84bdb7db692da57b10641.



Reason for revert: Breaks iOS test. See crbug.com/1470185



Original change's description:

> Recognize Clipboard Search suggestions as Search types.

>

> This change ensures Clipboard suggestions are correctly categorized as

> either URL (CLIPBOARD_URL) or Search (CLIPBOARD_TEXT,

> CLIPBOARD_IMAGE).

>

> The Search clipboard types feature custom description: (Text you

> copied / Image you copied), but for the sake of completeness, this

> change ensures that the keyword field is also populated.

>

> The change ensures that Clipboard text and image suggestions do not

> show up if the text/image searches are not supported by the template

> url, or are blocked by policy.

>

> Bug: 1468402

> Change-Id: Id55fe397c9d58d6c7ae1c3bd7b05ad08058b431e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4744064

> Reviewed-by: Patrick Noland

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179409}

entry.title: [PA] Add CStringBuilder to replace std::ostringstream used by LogMessage.
entry.content:
Since std::ostringstream allocates and deallocates memory from heap, c.f. https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:buildtools/third_party/libc++/trunk/src/ios.cpp



std::ostringstream is not available inside memory allocation. Instead

add CStringBuilder (not resize, fixed buffer size) for LogMessage.



Change-Id: I8051978487acc5fc9b976d6085909b43f81d9d0d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4744311

Reviewed-by: Yuki Shiino

Commit-Queue: Takashi Sakamoto

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179481}

entry.title: [Graphite] Add caching to GraphiteImageProvider
entry.content:
This CL adds caching to GraphiteImageProvider. The initial caching

structure is simple:



* We adopt the caching from Skia's TestingImageProvider

* As that cache is allowed to grow unbounded, we add a simple purging

strategy wherein the cache is purged if necessary before adding a

new entry to support staying below the max limit post-the addition of

that new entry (We set the max limit to match that used for Ganesh's

similar cache)



Future work can optimize this caching strategy if/as necessary based on

addition of metrics and gathering of data from the field.



Bug: 1457525

Change-Id: I3913b7814093ca05b324b5184f3fcfa0396d271f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720026

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179480}

entry.title: [Desktop][I18n] Don't clear static editor fields in payments editor.
entry.content:
Current implementation retains only email field and clears other fields

to make sure only user visible fields are saved in the AutofillProfile.

However, this logic doesn't take into account that fact that other

editors might add more fields, which are not present in this editor.

This is the case for the honorific prefix, which is currently hidden

under the feature flag.



This CL generalises the implementation by retaining all fields which

might be statically added to the editor. Effectively we use a single

source of truth to get this field set instead of a set of hard coded

values.



Bug: 1441904

Change-Id: I8e7a53d05d9d8594966db882761837c98a76af9b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742464

Reviewed-by: Norge Vizcay

Commit-Queue: Timofey Chudakov

entry.title: [text-autospace] Implement spacing insertion logic in ShapeResult
entry.content:
The callers are supposed to compute the positions where the spacing

should be inserted to, with the width of the spacing, and then pass the

list to ShapeResult.

The ShapeResult will scan glyph_data_ and add extra spacing.



A follow-up will test and implement the RTL case.

entry.title: [Telemetry] Add ExternalDisplay Event Implementation with ExternalDisplayInfo
entry.content:
Add implementation for reporting the external display info when

receiving an `ExternalDisplay` event.



The struct is defined by cros_healthd_probe.mojom and

probe_service.mojom, and included by cros_healthd_events.mojom and

telemetry_event_service.mojom.



The converters at the mojom level will reuse those defined in the

probe namespace already.



Since chromium IDL does not support import, we will define two

separate definitions at the IDL level.



Bug: b/289312077

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*Telemetry*Event*"

Test: extensions_unittests --gtest_filter="*TelemetryExtension*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*TelemetryExtensionEventsApi*"

entry.title: Refactor the early RFH swap logic into a separate function.
entry.content:
There are plans to move this to be called later in the navigation's

lifetime, after DidStartNavigation and possibly after processing

WillStartRequest() for NavigationThrottles. There are also plans to

expand conditions for performing the early swap. To simplify all this

upcoming work, move the early swap logic into its own function. All the

conditions are preserved, so there should be no behavior change.

entry.title: Implementation of singular Ukm entries
entry.content:
This feature will allow a UkmEntry to be updated and only the final version to be recorded by the UKM Service.



Mojo is used to support UkmEntries being collected by processes other than the browser. Additionally, it allows for the entry to be recorded when the process is killed without any additional complexity. However, multi-process UkmEntries are not supported but can be with additional changes.

entry.title: WebNN: Share the Adapter with multiple contexts on the same adapter
entry.content:
This CL addresses a TODO of CL-4647885 [1] that recommends multiple

contexts should share one command queue when they are on the same

adapter for better concurrency.



To implement this optimization, this CL moves the

`dml::Adapter::Create()` method to private and adds

`dml::Adapter::GetInstance()` method which only creates a new instance

if the instance doesn’t exist for a physical adapter.



`WebNNContextProviderImpl` would call `dml::Adapter::GetInstance()` when

creating a context. `dml::ContextImpl` is introduced to keep a reference

to the `dml::Adapter` instance and pass the queue and device to

`dml::GraphImpl` when creating the graph. The `Adapter` instance is

shared and reference-counted by all `dml::ContextImpl` and it is

released when all references are destroyed.



At the current stage, only the default `Adapter` for the adapter queried

from ANGLE is supported. In the future, the `Adapter` instance will be

created based on context options.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647885/comment/b24ff17b_69849b90/



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I8acf4af3ef23f514c83c34b84368eb9f4bf4de73

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4733931

Reviewed-by: Rafael Cintron

Commit-Queue: ningxin hu

entry.title: Do not start ServiceWorker when the matched source is "network"
entry.content:
This CL changes the behavior of starting the ServiceWorker when the

router matches.



For main resource, this behavior change is implemented behind the

feature param. For subresource, we change the default behavior.



As a default, the Static Routing API asynchronously start the

ServiceWorker even if the request matches the condition and skips the

fetch handler so that subsequent requests are seamlessly intercepted by

fetch handler.



However, based on the conversation with partners, there is a need not to

start the ServiceWorker. This behavior may be intuitive rather than the

implicit ServiceWorker start.



We may conduct an A/B testing to explore performance wins and possible

breakage risk in the future.



Change-Id: I6c2cbbe8ff93989db30a9e7dc6a30db06852d20d

entry.title: Always create opaque Vulkan external semaphores in ExternalSemaphore
entry.content:
Instead of relying on the platform VulkanImplementation to be using

opaque semaphores as the primary external semaphore handle type, we now

create opaque external semaphores directly to ensure that

ExternalVkImageBacking always work even if the VulkanImplementation is

using e.g. sync files as the primary external semaphore handle type.

entry.title: Revert "[CodeHealth] Fix a dangling pointer in UkmObserver"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 87aa165e938e25738c263bf8b5cbb4626b5b8f36.



Reason for revert: This CL seems to be causing bot failure in

crbug.com/1469883.



Original change's description:

> [CodeHealth] Fix a dangling pointer in UkmObserver

>

> On the one hand, UkmObserver holds a raw pointer reference to

> UKMRecorderImpl (ukm_recorder_); on the other hand, UkmDatabaseClient

> , the parent class of UkmObserver, is a static singleton. These two

> setups jointly lead to the fact that the raw pointer ukm_recorder_ is

> never properly released.

>

> This CL fixes this issue by explicitly setting UkmObserver to null in

> UkmDatabaseClient when its lifecycle should end, so that we can

> trigger the destruction process.

entry.content:
This change ensures Clipboard suggestions are correctly categorized as

either URL (CLIPBOARD_URL) or Search (CLIPBOARD_TEXT,

CLIPBOARD_IMAGE).



The Search clipboard types feature custom description: (Text you

copied / Image you copied), but for the sake of completeness, this

change ensures that the keyword field is also populated.



The change ensures that Clipboard text and image suggestions do not

show up if the text/image searches are not supported by the template

url, or are blocked by policy.

entry.title: Simplify EntitySuggestionProcessor.
entry.content:
Now that we migrated image fetching to the common space, the Entity

processor's mechanisms have reduced to text processing.



This change consolidates most of that processing with the Basic

suggestion processor, that also handles highlighting.



The processor is kept for two reasons

1) it still handles fallback color;

2) we expect some custom handling to be applied to Entities

specifically; one such example is crbug/1455442;

3) it is unclear whether we will handle Categorical Suggestions

similarly to Entities.



Note: the change drops support for SEARCH_SUGGEST_PROFILE, which was a

Google+ specific suggestion.



Screenshot (before/after): http://screen/KkJf6qbusaCSn2f.png

Observe that the refine completion on Entity Suggestions is now

correctly highlighted.



Bug: 1468402

Change-Id: Icd5eb0e6b36eeb4801b0a1719eb36d04704205a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748929

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: Ensure suggestions always have fallback icon and retrieve images.
entry.content:
This change removes code explicitly applying fallback image to

suggestions and moves it to the base class, ensuring that all

suggestions will always feature a decoration icon (globe or magnifying

glass).



The change introduces image retrieval to BasicsuggestionProcessor.

entry.title: bruschetta: Learn more link and general name from policy
entry.content:
* Installer has a learn more link to an address provided by policy

* Set a general name (e.g. HappyVm) used in the installer for the set of

supported configurations in policy, falling back to the name of the

first (by display order) configuration if unset.



I also created a policy group for Bruschetta and moved the existing

BruschettaVMConfig policy into it, since we now have multiple policies.



Bug: b:283283781

entry.title: Limit 64-bit experiment to Trichrome
entry.content:
Turns out that only devices that are compatible with version code ending

with x33 will participate and the Play coin toss (the experiment). The

2nd to last digit indicates Trichrome.



The issue was discovered when we observed a lot of 584505121 stuck on

32-bit, not being able to update 64-bit. Hence they shouldn't be in the

study.



Bug: 1462131

Change-Id: I0ec80f00ca3807839eeeda6f6a3db7003a66b33d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4749979

Auto-Submit: Bartek Nowierski

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179391}

entry.title: Reland "Add WebDriver test for CSS 'resize'"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 488fd2c958c9c4a5e38307798f2a1ac25559977e



The commit was reverted because the test was failing when run with

--enable-leak-detection, with this leak log:

({

"numberOfLiveDocuments":[1,2],

"numberOfLiveNodes":[4,37],

"numberOfLiveResourceFetchers":[1,2],

"numberOfLiveResources":[0,5]

})



I think that's a problem of the WebDriver API.



Removing the test cases trying to resize an element with 'resize: none'

avoids the problem, and since that's the initial value, they don't seem

much important.



So I think we can reland the test without these cases.



Original change's description:

> Add WebDriver test for CSS 'resize'

>

> In particular, this tests the change from CL:4308393, i.e. resolving

> 'resize: block' and 'resize: inline' using the writing mode of the

> element itself, instead of the one of the containing block.

>

> Bug: 850004

> Change-Id: I15deae5cabd5e92afd6d0405f46769be525c0bd2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4738818

> Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

> Commit-Queue: Oriol Brufau

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178430}



Bug: 850004

Change-Id: Ifd4196b15263adb5dd71cc5c83e264a4812e2fa3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742606
